verses.verse: My son <WH1121>, attend <WH7181> unto my wisdom <WH2451>; Incline <WH5186> thine ear <WH241> to my understanding <WH8394>:
That thou mayest preserve <WH8104> discretion <WH4209>, And that thy lips <WH8193> may keep <WH5341> knowledge <WH1847>.
For the lips <WH8193> of a strange woman <WH2114> drop <WH5197> honey <WH5317>, And her mouth <WH2441> is smoother <WH2509> than oil <WH8081>:
But in the end <WH319> she is bitter <WH4751> as wormwood <WH3939>, Sharp <WH2299> as a two-edged <WH6310> sword <WH2719>.
Her feet <WH7272> go down <WH3381> to death <WH4194>; Her steps <WH6806> take hold <WH8551> on Sheol <WH7585>;
So that she findeth <WH6424> not the level path <WH734> of life <WH2416>: Her ways <WH4570> are unstable <WH5128>, and she knoweth it not <WH3045>.
Now therefore <WH1121>, my sons, hearken <WH8085> unto me <WH5493>, And depart not from the words <WH561> of my mouth <WH6310>.
Remove <WH7368> thy way <WH1870> far <WH7368> from her <WH7126>, And come not nigh the door <WH6607> of her house <WH1004>;
Lest thou give <WH5414> thine honor <WH1935> unto others <WH312>, And thy years <WH8141> unto the cruel <WH394>;
Lest strangers <WH2114> be filled <WH7646> with thy strength <WH3581>, And thy labors <WH6089> be in the house <WH1004> of an alien <WH5237>,
And thou mourn <WH5098> at thy latter <WH319> end <WH1320>, When thy flesh and thy body <WH1320> are consumed <WH3615>,
And say <WH559>, How have I hated <WH8130> instruction <WH4148>, And my heart <WH3820> despised <WH5006> reproof <WH8433>;
Neither have I obeyed <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of my teachers <WH3384>, Nor inclined <WH5186> mine ear <WH241> to them that instructed me <WH3925>!
I was well-nigh <WH4592> in all evil <WH7451> In the midst <WH8432> of the assembly <WH6951> and congregation <WH6951>.
Drink <WH8354> waters <WH4325> out of thine own cistern <WH953>, And running waters <WH5140> out of <WH8432> thine own well <WH875>.
Should thy springs <WH4599> be dispersed <WH6327> abroad <WH2351>, And streams <WH6388> of water <WH4325> in the streets <WH7339>?
Let them be for thyself alone <WH2114>, And not for strangers with thee.
Let thy fountain <WH4726> be blessed <WH1288>; And rejoice <WH8055> in the wife <WH802> of thy youth <WH5271>.

As a loving <WH158> hind <WH365> and a pleasant <WH2580> doe <WH365>, Let her breasts <WH1717> satisfy <WH7301> thee at all times <WH6256>; And be thou ravished <WH7686> always <WH8548> with her love <WH160>.
For why shouldest thou <WH1121>, my son, be ravished <WH7686> with a strange woman <WH2114>, And embrace <WH2263> the bosom <WH2436> of a foreigner <WH5237>?
For the ways <WH1870> of man <WH376> are before <WH5227> the eyes <WH5869> of Jehovah <WH3068>; And he maketh level <WH6424> all his paths <WH4570>.
His own iniquities <WH5771> shall take <WH3920> the wicked <WH7563>, And he shall be holden <WH8551> with the cords <WH2256> of his sin <WH2403>.
He shall die <WH4191> for lack of instruction <WH4148>; And in the greatness <WH7230> of his folly <WH200> he shall go astray <WH7686>.
